channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Listen to the CNN presidential debate simulcast on NPR
item.description: You can tune into the CNN presidential debate tonight at 9 p.m. ET on CNN or simulcast on NPR. Find it — and NPR analysis following the debate — on NPR.org, many public radio stations or the NPR app.
item.content:encoded: You can tune into the CNN presidential debate tonight at 9 p.m. ET on CNN or simulcast on NPR. Find it — and NPR analysis following the debate — on NPR.org, many public radio stations or the NPR app.

item.title: The Glastonbury Festival goes environmental and family friendly
item.description: NPR takes listeners on a tour of the world’s biggest music fest: 200,000+ campers in a muddy field, rocking out. In recent years, Glastonbury has gone plastic-free, family-friendly and accessible for all.
item.content:encoded: NPR takes listeners on a tour of the world’s biggest music fest: 200,000+ campers in a muddy field, rocking out. In recent years, Glastonbury has gone plastic-free, family-friendly and accessible for all.
item.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer

item.title: For Native Americans, the birth of a rare white bison is a blessing and a warning
item.description: A rare white-colored buffalo calf was born in Yellowstone National Park this spring. It's interesting for tourists, but many Native Americans see it as the fulfillment of a prophecy.
item.content:encoded: A rare white-colored buffalo calf was born in Yellowstone National Park this spring. It's interesting for tourists, but many Native Americans see it as the fulfillment of a prophecy.
item.dc:creator: Hanna Merzbach

item.title: How tonight's debate differs from the last time Trump and Biden faced off
item.description: Thursday night's presidential debate is not merely a replay of 2020. Here's a look at the dynamics, what's changed or not since 2020, and what to expect tonight.
item.content:encoded: Thursday night's presidential debate is not merely a replay of 2020. Here's a look at the dynamics, what's changed or not since 2020, and what to expect tonight.
item.dc:creator: Mara Liasson

item.title: This week in science: a new dinosaur, a lynx revival and an looming star explosion
item.description: NPR's Ari Shapiro talks with Regina Barber and Kimberly McCoy of Short Wave about an impending star explosion, a lynx that’s come back from the brink of extinction, and a newly discovered dinosaur.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ari Shapiro talks with Regina Barber and Kimberly McCoy of Short Wave about an impending star explosion, a lynx that’s come back from the brink of extinction, and a newly discovered dinosaur.
item.dc:creator: Regina Barber

item.title: The Supreme Court’s conservative majority curtailed the SEC’s ability to impose fines
item.description: The U.S. Supreme Court issued multiple consequential decisions on Thursday, on everything from opioids to ozone pollution.
item.content:encoded: The U.S. Supreme Court issued multiple consequential decisions on Thursday, on everything from opioids to ozone pollution.
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: Study shows incarcerated women experience different conditions than men
item.description: One in three convicted women are held in jail rather than prison, compared to about 1 in 10 of all convicted people. But compared to prisons, jails tend to have fewer resources and support systems.
item.content:encoded: One in three convicted women are held in jail rather than prison, compared to about 1 in 10 of all convicted people. But compared to prisons, jails tend to have fewer resources and support systems.
item.dc:creator: Meg Anderson

item.title: U.S. Supreme Court blocks the EPA’s plan to combat interstate air pollution
item.description: The U.S. Supreme Court on Thursday temporarily blocked the Environmental Protection Agency’s “Good Neighbor Plan", which was designed to protect downwind states from air pollution.
item.content:encoded: The U.S. Supreme Court on Thursday temporarily blocked the Environmental Protection Agency’s “Good Neighbor Plan", which was designed to protect downwind states from air pollution.
item.dc:creator: Gurjit Kaur

item.title: Supreme Court tosses out bankruptcy plan for Purdue Pharma and Sackler family
item.description: The Supreme Court struck down a controversial Purdue Pharma bankruptcy plan, affecting compensation to thousands of opioid victims and sending legal shockwaves through the U.S. bankruptcy system.
item.content:encoded: The Supreme Court struck down a controversial Purdue Pharma bankruptcy plan, affecting compensation to thousands of opioid victims and sending legal shockwaves through the U.S. bankruptcy system.
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: Biden and Trump go head to head tonight. What are the stakes?
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with Republican strategist Doug Heye and Democratic strategist Faiz Shakir about the stakes for Thursday's presidential debate.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with Republican strategist Doug Heye and Democratic strategist Faiz Shakir about the stakes for Thursday's presidential debate.
item.dc:creator: Juana Summers
